sections.text: Penalty clausesA provision in a juridical act that purports to penalize a person for filing an action to challenge aninter vivosormortis causadonation, an action related to a succession, or an action related to a trust administration is unenforceable if, at the time of instituting the action to challenge, a factual basis existed that would lead a reasonable person to conclude that there is a substantial likelihood that the challenge would be successful.Acts 2025, No. 39, ยง1.
